data.title: Kansas State University

data.text:
FRESHMAN (2015)

One of K-State’s most frequently used relievers, he was 2-2 with a 3.55 ERA (10er, 25.1ip) in 19 appearances (one start) ... Southpaw did not allow an earned run in any of his 6 Big 12 relief appearances, striking out 5 and issuing no walks over 4.0 innings ... Did not allow a run of his own from March 22-April 12, a stretch of 5 2/3 consecutive scoreless innings ... Had a 1.64 ERA (2er, 11.0ip) over a 10-game stretch from March 22-May 2 ... Only issued 2 walks in his final 15 1/3 innings while striking out 9 ... His last appearance of the season was his first career start as he allowed 2 runs on 6 hits over 2 2/3 innings on May 9 vs. Oklahoma ... Allowed 4 earned runs in his last 2 appearances (8.31 ERA) ... Surrendered just 6 hits among his 26 total safeties against.

HIGH SCHOOL

Attended Mayo (MN) High School ... Lettered three years in baseball, playing for Dan Hoefs ... Named all-state as a senior by the Minnesota State High School Baseball Coaches Association (MSHSBCA) as well as all-conference ... In 2014, was 9-1 with a 1.22 ERA (12er, 69.0ip), 105 strikeouts and 17 walks in 12 games (5 starts) ... As a junior, he was 3-2 with a 2.62 ERA (17er, 45.1ip), 33 strikeouts and 22 walks in 8 games ... Also participated on the alpine ski team.

PERSONAL

Born on September 22, 1995 in Rochester, Minnesota ... Mother is Marsha Douglas ... Has a younger brother, Stephen ... Majored in sociology.
